revised_title: Infra-Red Investigations of Molecular Structure: The Simplest Kind of Polyatomic Molecule
tldr: The authors conducted infra-red investigations on the simplest kind of polyatomic molecule, CS2, to study its molecular structure and vibration-rotation spectra. They analyzed the fine structure of the bands and used intensity as a guide to assign the bands to suitable vibrations. This work provides valuable data for understanding the structure and behavior of polyatomic molecules, contributing to the field of molecular spectroscopy.
